In this case, the given statement "If the bear was in the cave, then the wolf was in the den" is the conditional statement, and "The wolf was in the den" is known to be true. We want to infer "The bear was in the cave", which is the consequent of the conditional statement.

To determine if we can logically infer "The bear was in the cave", we need to check if the given statement "The wolf was in the den" matches the antecedent of the conditional statement. In this case, it does.

Answer: Yes.
